message:
I'll help solve this system of linear equations step by step using Gaussian elimination to put the augmented matrix [A|b] in row echelon form.

Starting augmented matrix [A|b]:
[2  1  -1 | 8]
[-3 -1  2 | -11]
[-2  1  2 | -3]

Let's work through this:

1) First pivot (R1):
[2  1  -1 | 8]
[-3 -1  2 | -11]
[-2  1  2 | -3]

2) Eliminate below first pivot:
R2 + (3/2)R1
R3 + R1

After these operations:
[2  1  -1 | 8]
[0  0.5  0.5 | 1]
[0  2   1 | 5]

3) Second pivot (using R3):
[2  1  -1 | 8]
[0  2   1 | 5]
[0  0.5  0.5 | 1]

4) Eliminate below second pivot:
[2  1  -1 | 8]
[0  2   1 | 5]
[0  0   0 | -0.75]

The system is inconsistent because the last row becomes [0 0 0 | -0.75], which indicates no solution exists.

Therefore, this system of linear equations has no solution.
